name: Bakersfield Racquet Club
description: Bakersfield Racquet Club is one of the most popular places to play pickleball in Bakersfield, CA. There are 4 outdoor hard courts. These are dedicated courts with permanent lines and nets. Amenities include restrooms, food, water, lights, a pro shop or equipment store, trainers or lessons, wheelchair accessibility, adaptive programming, youth programming, and locker rooms. A membership is required to play.

name: Beale Park
description: Beale Park is a place to play pickleball in Bakersfield, CA. There are 6 outdoor hard courts. These are dedicated courts with permanent lines and nets. Amenities include restrooms and water. You can’t reserve the courts. The courts are free.

name: Bear Valley Springs
description: Bear Valley Springs is one of the most popular places to play pickleball in Tehachapi, CA. There are 4 outdoor courts. These are dedicated courts with permanent lines and nets. A one-time fee is required to play.

name: Gameday Sports Academy
description: Come play pickleball at Gameday Sports Academy in Bakersfield, CA! There are 10 indoor hard courts. These are dedicated courts with permanent lines and nets. The courts are private. Players have access to restrooms. You can reserve the courts.

description: Come play pickleball at Greenacres Park PicklePlex in Bakersfield, CA! There are 8 outdoor asphalt and hard courts. These are dedicated courts with permanent lines and nets. The courts are free. The facility includes amenities like restrooms, water, and lights.

name: Leroy Jackson Park
description: The best portable nets ever! Signs say tennis players must yield to pickleball.
